title: Add a new Authorized Signatory from a Place on Major League Paternity List tx
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has edit permissions in the Authorized Signatory widget
AND a "New" link appears above the Authorized Signatory field in edit mode
custom_steps: WHEN clicking "New"
custom_expected:
THEN modal will launch
AND user will be able to enter a new Authorized Signatory for the player's Org
AND the checkbox associated with the form the user is adding a new signatory from will be auto checked and disabled
AND the Save button will be disabled until all required fields have been populated.
AND clicking Save will add the AS to the system and close the modal

title: BOC user approving a Place on Major League Paternity List tx to create an entry in the daily tx bulletin
custom_preconds: GIVEN a Place on Major League Paternity List transaction is approved
custom_steps: WHEN on the Daily tx bulletin
custom_expected: THEN the tx should appear on the current Pending Daily Transaction Bulletin as "Placed on Major League Paternity List"

title: BOC user reverses a Place on Major League Paternity List tx to create an entry in the daily tx bulletin
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a Place on Major League Paternity List transaction is Approved
AND then the tx is Reversed
custom_steps:
WHEN on the Daily tx bulletin
AND the bulletin entry is still on the Pending Bulletin
custom_expected:
THEN the tx should be removed
BUT if it was on a previous Bulletin, then a new entry should be added to the current Pending Daily
AND Transaction Bulletin as "Placed on Major League Paternity List - Reversed"

title: BOC user suppresses a Place on Major League Paternity List tx to create an entry in the daily tx bulletin
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a Place on Major League Paternity List transaction is Reversed
AND then Suppressed
custom_steps:
WHEN on the Daily tx bulletin
AND still on the Pending Bulletin
custom_expected: THEN the tx should be removed.

title: User can receive a notification on the 3rd day of a player's Paternity List placement
custom_preconds: GIVEN a player has been on the Paternity List fro 3 days or more
custom_steps: WHEN the nightly
custom_expected:
THEN a new notification is generated for both the BOC- Major Transactions- Admin and the Club- Major Transactions- Admin users. 
AND Type will be Inactive List. 
AND The notification description should be Please Reinstate from Major League Paternity List. 
AND Both the player name and the notification description should link to the Player's Player History.

title: BOC user can create a new Reinstate from Inactive List tx fro a MJ player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN there is a "Create New" button on the Player History widget for all players.
AND "Transactions" is an option in the top-level dropdown
AND "Major" and "Minor" radio buttons is active, 
AND selecting "Major" will limit the third and fourth levels to only Major items 
AND "Inactive List" should be an option under Major Transactions.
AND "Reinstate from Inactive List" should be an option in the fourth level dropdown
custom_steps: WHEN Selecting "Reinstate from Inactive List"
custom_expected:
THEN the system will check to see if there is an existing Preliminary MJ Place on Reinstate from Inactive List transaction for the same player created within 10 days of the current date
AND If a preliminary transaction already exists, the system will load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction. 
BUT If no preliminary transaction created within 10 days of the current date exists, the system will load a new Preliminary transaction.

title: User can view an existing Reinstate from Inactive List transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN there is an existing Reinstate from Inactive List tx
custom_steps: WHEN clicking on the tx in a player's Player History
custom_expected:
THEN the tx will open in the same window
AND the layout will match the view mode of the provided wireframe
AND the "Close" button on the form in will be grey
AND The field Current Status will display in red if the transaction is in a preliminary state, green if pending and black for all other states.

title: User can create a new Reinstate from Inactive List transaction for a MN player
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on a player's history widget
custom_steps: WHEN Selecting "Reinstate from Inactive List" from the Create New
custom_expected:
THEN If no preliminary, submitted or rejected transaction is created within 10 days of the current date exists, the system will load a new Preliminary transaction
BUT if preliminary or rejected transaction already exists, the system will load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction

title: User can edit an existing Reinstate from Inactive List transaction for a player BOC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is a BOC User
AND there is an existing Reinstate from Inactive List tx
AND the tx is Preliminary or Rejected state
custom_steps: WHEN clicking Edit
custom_expected:
THEN BOC is able to edit all fields in all states except for Approved and Reversed transactions.
BUT  Approved and Reversed states, edit only gives BOC access to attach new files or edit existing attachments. 
AND They can also update "Comments" and "BOC Notes" fields

title: User can edit an existing Reinstate from Inactive List transaction for a player CLUB
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is a Club User
AND there is an existing Reinstate from Inactive List tx
AND the tx is Preliminary or Rejected state
custom_steps: WHEN clicking Edit
custom_expected:
THEN user will be able to edit all portions displayed on the form
BUT In Approved and Reversed states, edit only gives Clubs access to attach new files, 
AND cannot edit any other part of transaction

title: Club user will see Reinstate from Inactive List greyed out in the Create New map for a MJ player from their Player History
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is a Club User
custom_steps: WHEN selecting the MJ option from the Create New map
custom_expected:
THEN Reinstate from Inactive List will be greyed out on the MJ League Menu
BUt not on the MN League Menu

title: User can add a new Authorized Signatory from a Reinstate from Inactive List transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has edit capabilities 
AND a Reinstate from Inactive List tx is in edit mode
custom_steps: WHEN clicking NEW link above the authorized Signatory field
custom_expected:
THEN the modal will launch
AND allow the user to enter a new Authorized Signatory for the player's ORG
AND the checkbox associated with the form the user is adding a new signatory from will be auto checked and disabled
AND clicking save will add the AS to the system and close the modal,
AND the AS field will be pre-populated with the newly added Authorized Signatory

title: Reinstate from Inactive List Permissions - BOC - Minor Transactions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is a BOC user
custom_steps: WHEN on a Reinstate from Inactive List tx (Minor)
custom_expected:
THEN ADMINS can view and Print all minor league transactions in all states for Minor League Players
AND Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states
AND Can create, delete, edit, e-sign and submit all Minor league transactions for Minor League players
AND Can Approve, Reject, Reverse and Suppress all Minor League transactions and see associated Flags
BUT BASIC Can only view and Print all minor league transactions in all states for Minor League Players but cannot make any changes or e-sign.
AND Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.

title: Reinstate from Inactive List Permissions - Club - Minor Transactions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is a Club user
custom_steps: WHEN on a Reinstate from Inactive List tx (Minor)
custom_expected:
THEN as a BASIC Club users can view and print all minor league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction
BUT as an ADMIN Club users with this role can view and print all minor league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions
AND Can create, delete, submit, edit, or attach files to any non-BOC Only Minor League transactions for Minor League players (ADMIN)
AND Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) minor league transactions including other club's Minor League transactions or BOC only transactions
AND cannot see suppressed tx
AND cannot see BOC Notes field
AND  Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
AND Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org (ADMIN)

title: Reinstate from Inactive List Permissions - BOC - Major Transactions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is a BOC user
custom_steps: WHEN on a Reinstate from Inactive List tx (Major)
custom_expected:
THEN ADMINS can view and Print all minor league transactions in all states for Minor League Players
AND Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states
AND Can create, delete, edit, e-sign and submit all Minor league transactions for Minor League players
AND Can Approve, Reject, Reverse and Suppress all Minor League transactions and see associated Flags
BUT BASIC Can only view and Print all minor league transactions in all states for Minor League Players but cannot make any changes or e-sign.
AND Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.

title: Reinstate from Inactive List Permissions - Club - Major Transactions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is a Club user
custom_steps: WHEN on a Reinstate from Inactive List tx (Major)
custom_expected:
THEN as a BASIC Club users can view and print all minor league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction
BUT as an ADMIN Club users with this role can view and print all minor league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions
AND Can create, delete, submit, edit, or attach files to any non-BOC Only Minor League transactions for Minor League players (ADMIN)
AND Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) minor league transactions including other club's Minor League transactions or BOC only transactions
AND cannot see suppressed tx
AND cannot see BOC Notes field
AND  Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
AND Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org (ADMIN)

title: User can delete a Reinstate from Inactive List transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN there is a Reinstate from Inactive List Tx
AND User has edit permissions
custom_steps:
WHEN the tx is in Preliminary or Rejected State
AND clicking Delete
custom_expected:
THEN the form should be closed and no record should be kept
AND User should be returned to entry point of the transaction and a blue notification should be thrown

title: Club user will receive a notification Reinstate from Inactive List transaction is approved, rejected, or reversed
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is a club user
custom_steps: WHEN a Reinstate from Inactive List tx is approved, rejected, or reversed
custom_expected:
THEN Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Approved or Rejected or Reversed
AND Description will be a hyperlink
AND Player's name will be a hyperlink

title: BOC user can reverse, reverse and suppress or suppress a Reinstate from Inactive List transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is a BOC user
AND a Reinstate from Inactive List tx is in a state of Approved
custom_steps:
WHEN clicking Reverse
AND clicking Suppress
custom_expected:
THEN The transaction status is updated to "Reversed"
AND Display reversed transaction in player history with “Voided:” in front of the transaction description. Example:” Voided: Major/Minor Outright”
AND Set the player's MJ and MN Roster Status, Club and Org to their values from prior to the transaction approval.
AND When a transaction is suppressed it will be hidden from the player's Player History, Searches and any other place where it is visible on UI
BUT Clicking "Reverse and Suppress" will first reverse, and then suppress the transaction

title: User can submit a Reinstate from Inactive List transaction to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has a MN league Reinstate from Inactive List tx
custom_steps:
WHEN the transaction is in a preliminary or rejected state
clicking Submit to BOC button
custom_expected:
THEN System reloads the transaction in view mode, and displays a successful submit blue notification
AND the system sets the player’s pending Roster Status to whatever it was prior to being placed on the Inactive List.
AND When a transaction reaches a status of "Submitted to BOC" an approval item will be generated and display on the BOC - Minor Transactions - Admin's Approvals widget
AND If a file is attached to the transaction, that is displayed and available for download from the Attachments column of the Approvals widget. 
AND If Comments are populated on the transaction, they display in the Comments column of the Approvals widget.
AND Player name is a hyperlink in the Approvals widget. Clicking on the player name will open the Player Profile (defaults to Player History tab) in the same window/tab. 
AND "Type" will be a hyperlink. Clicking on the type hyperlink of a submitted transaction will open the submitted transaction in view mode in the same window/tab

title: BOC user can reject a Reinstate from Inactive List transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is a BOC user
AND the Reinstate from Inactive List tx is Preliminary or Submitted to BOC
custom_steps: WHEN clicking Reject
custom_expected:
THEN the transaction status is updated to "Rejected"
AND Successful reject notification is displayed
AND If the item was on the Approvals Clipboard, that is removed from the approvals clipboard. 
AND Reverse player's Pending org and club. 
AND Remove pending player history entry.

title: BOC user can approve a Reinstate from Inactive List transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is a BOC user
AND the Reinstate from Inactive List tx is Preliminary or Submitted to BOC
custom_steps: WHEN clicking Approve
custom_expected:
THEN the transaction status is updated to "Approved"
AND If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
AND A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was approved.
AND Update player's MJ or MN Roster Statuses accordingly to be what it was prior to being placed on the Inactive List, unless "Do Not Activate" checkbox is checked.
AND If Do Not Activate checkbox is checked, set the player's Roster status to "Reinstated/Not Active"

title: User will receive an error if the player I'm attempting to create a Reinstate from Inactive List transaction for is not a minor league player
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has a MJ league player
custom_steps: WHEN Selecting "Reinstate from Inactive List" from the MN Create New menu
custom_expected: THEN the error message will display "This transaction is for Minor League players only"

title: User will receive an error if the player I'm attempting to create a MN Reinstate from Inactive List transaction for does not have a valid MN Roster status
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is on a MJ league player's Player History
custom_steps: WHEN Selecting "Reinstate from Inactive List" from the MN Create New menu
custom_expected: THEN an error will display "This player is not currently on an Inactive List."

title: User will receive an error if the player I'm attempting to create a MJ Reinstate from Inactive List transaction for is not a major league player
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is on a MN league player's Player History
custom_steps: WHEN Selecting "Reinstate from Inactive List" from the MJ Create New menu
custom_expected: THEN the error will display "This transaction is for Major League players only"

title: User will receive an error if the player I'm attempting to create a MJ Reinstate from Inactive List transaction for does not have a valid MJ Roster status
custom_preconds: GIVEN a MJ player does not have a MJ Roster status of Military, Strike, Suspended, Bereavement, Voluntarily Retired, Paternity, Disqualified, Ineligible, or Restricted.
custom_steps: WHEN Selecting "Place on Suspended List" from the MJ Create New menu
custom_expected: THEN the error will display "This player is not currently on an Inactive List."

title: Club user is prevented from initiating a Reinstate from Inactive List transaction for a player that does not belong to my Club
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is a Club user
AND If the Org of the initiating user is not BOC or the Current Org of the player
custom_steps: WHEN Selecting "Reinstate from Inactive List" on the MN Create New menu for a player from their Player History
custom_expected:
THEN the blocking message will display 
"You do not have permission to create a transaction for a player that belongs to another Organization."
**Hint Text:**"If you believe you have received this message in error, please contact the BOC."

title: User will receive an error if I have back or future dated my Reinstate from Inactive List more than 2 days
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has a tx for a Reinstate from Inactive List
AND assignment date is more than 2 days prior to or after the current date
custom_steps: WHEN clicking Submit or Approve
custom_expected: THEN display the error "Transaction Date must be within 2 days of submission."

title: User will receive an error if the player I am creating a Reinstate from Inactive List transaction for has a pending or approved transaction after the entered assignment date
custom_preconds: GIVEN a Reinstate from Inactive List tx Assignment date is before the latest approved or pending (Pending to Club, Submitted to BOC) transaction date for the player
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking "Submit" or "Approve"
custom_expected: THEN the error will display "A transaction cannot occur before the date of player's latest approved or pending transaction, on <TX Date>."

title: User will receive an error if I am attempting to Reinstate a player from the Ineligible list less than a year from the placement date
custom_preconds: GIVEN the date the player was placed on the Ineligible List is less than one year ago before the Reinstatement Date (can be equal to one year from Placement Date)
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking "Submit" or "Approve"
custom_expected: THEN the error will display "This player cannot be reinstated from the Ineligible List until [insert date 1 year from the Ineligible List placement date]."

title: BOC Approver will receive an error when approving a Reinstate from Inactive List transaction with an assignment date after the current date
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the current date is after the assignment date entered on the transaction.
AND the tx is a Reinstate from Inactive List tx
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking "Approve"
custom_expected: THEN the error will display "This transaction cannot be approved unless the transaction date is on or before the current date."

title: BOC Approver will receive an error when attempting to approve a Reinstate from Inactive List transaction for a player that has a prior pending transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN the current date is after the assignment date entered on the transaction
custom_steps: WHEN  Clicking "Approve"
custom_expected: THEN the error will display "This transaction cannot be approved until the player's other pending transactions with earlier dates have been approved."

title: Recalculate player's CBT impact on approval of Reinstate from Inactive List
custom_preconds: GIVEN the Reinstate from Inactive List
custom_steps: WHEN clicking Approve
custom_expected: THEN the system will recalculate the CBT impact of the player.

title: User can view an existing Place on Deceased List transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in and wants to view an existing Place on Deceased List tx from a player's Player History
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on the tx in player's Player History
custom_expected:
THEN system should open the transaction in the same window
AND layout of the transaction should match the View mode of wireframe
AND fields should match data discovery
AND "Close" button should be visible on the form in grey
AND clicking "Close" should return the user to their entry point into the tx
AND field "Current Status" should display in red if the transaction is in a preliminary state, green if pending and black for all other states

title: BOC user can create a new Place on Deceased List transaction for a MJ player
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club or BOC user is logged in and viewing a player's Player History
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Create New" button on Player History Widget
custom_expected:
THEN "Transactions" should appear as an option in top-level dropdown
AND "Major" and "Minor" radio buttons should be active
AND selecting "Major" should limit third and fourth levels to only MJ items
AND "Inactive List" should be an option under Major Transactions
AND "Place on Deceased List" should be an option in the fourth level dropdown
AND if no Preliminary "Place on Deceased List" tx exists within the last 10 days, selecting "Place on Deceased List" will cause the system to load a new preliminary transaction
BUT if a Preliminary "Place on Deceased List" tx does exist within the last 10 days system should load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction
AND transaction should follow wireframe and data discovery

title: BOC user can create a new Place on Deceased List transaction for a MN player
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club or BOC user is logged in and viewing a player's Player History
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Create New" button on Player History Widget
custom_expected:
THEN "Transactions" should appear as an option in top-level dropdown
AND "Major" and "Minor" radio buttons should be active
AND selecting "Minor" should limit third and fourth levels to only MN items
AND "Inactive List" should be an option under Minor Transactions
AND "Place on Deceased List" should be an option in the fourth level dropdown
AND if no Preliminary "Place on Deceased List" tx exists within the last 10 days, selecting "Place on Deceased List" will cause the system to load a new preliminary transaction
BUT if a Preliminary "Place on Deceased List" tx does exist within the last 10 days system should load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction
AND transaction should follow wireframe and data discovery

title: Club user can see Place on Deceased List greyed out in the Create New map for a player from their Player History
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in as a club user
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the "Create New" map form a player's Player History
custom_expected:
THEN "Place on Deceased List" should be an option in the fourth level dropdown (Inactive List) for both MJ and MN players, but should be greyed out
AND user should not be allowed to select this option from "Create New" map

title: Club user will receive a notification when Place on Deceased List tx is approved or reversed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a Place on Deceased List transaction has been submitted to BOC
AND user is logged in as club user for the initiating club for the transaction, or the club the selected player belongs to
custom_steps:
WHEN the submitted Place on Deceased List transaction is updated to "Approved" or "Reversed"
AND the transaction is NOT also "Suppressed"
custom_expected:
THEN logged in user should receive a notification 
AND clicking description hyperlink of any of these notifications should open the transaction in view mode in the same window/tab
AND clicking player's name hyperlink of any of these notifications should open the player's profile in view mode in the same window/tab on the Player History tab

title: User can delete a Place on Deceased List transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a "Place on Deceased List" transaction exists for a player
AND the transaction is in a Preliminary or Rejected state
AND a user is logged in with edit permissions for the form 
AND grey "Delete" button is displayed on the form
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Delete" button
custom_expected:
THEN system should prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the form ("Are you sure you want to delete this [Place on Deceased List]?"
AND yes and no buttons should be displayed
AND clicking yes should close the form with no record kept, display a blue notification, and return user to entry point of the transaction
AND clicking no should return user to the form and take no action

title: BOC user can reverse a Place on Deceased List tx
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a "Place on Deceased List" transaction has been submitted for a player and approved
AND user is logged in as BOC user 
AND user is viewing the approved transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks grey "Reverse" button
custom_expected:
THEN system should run all required field and formatting checks and display relevant error or warning messages
AND successful reverse notification should display (message #16)
AND transaction status should update to "Reversed"
AND reversed transaction should display in Player History with "Voided" in front of the transaction
AND player's MJ and MN Roster Status, Club and Org should be set to values from prior to transaction approval

title: BOC user can suppress a reversed Place on Deceased List transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a reversed "Place on Deceased List" transaction exists for a player 
AND user is logged in with permission to suppress the transaction
AND grey "Suppress" button is displayed on the form
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Suppress" button
custom_expected:
THEN transaction should be suppressed
AND transaction should be hidden from player's Player History
AND transaction should be hidden from searches (unless BOC user searches specifically for suppressed)
AND transaction should be hidden from any other place it is visible on UI

title: BOC user can "Reverse and Suppress" a Place on Deceased List transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a reversed "Place on Deceased List" transaction exists for a player 
AND user is logged in with permission to "Reverse and Suppress" the transaction
AND grey "Reverse and Suppress" button is displayed on the form
custom_steps: WHEN user selects "Reverse and Suppress" from the dropdown
custom_expected:
THEN the transaction will first be reversed
AND player's Club, MJ, and MN Roster statuses and level of play should be updated to their values from prior to transaction approval
AND transaction should be suppressed
AND transaction should be hidden from player's Player History
AND transaction should be hidden from searches (unless BOC user searches specifically for suppressed)
AND transaction should be hidden from any other place it is visible on UI

title: BOC user can "Reverse and Suppress" a Place on Deceased List transaction - Not Latest approved tx
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a "Place on Deceased List" transaction has been submitted for a player and approved
AND user is logged in as BOC user 
AND user is viewing the approved transaction
AND player has one or more approved transactions dated later than selected transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Reverse" or "Reverse and Suppress" button
custom_expected:
THEN user will receive error message "Only the player's latest approved transaction can be reversed."
AND clicking "Back" will close modal and return user to the transaction

title: Place on Deceased List Permissions - BOC - Minor Transactions - Basic
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in with BOC-Minor-Transactions-Basic permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to view, print, create, delete, edit, e-sign, or submit, approve, reject, reverse, or suppress a Place on Deceased List tx
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to view and Print all minor league transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for Minor League Players
AND user should be able to view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states

title: Place on Deceased List Permissions - Club - Minor Transactions - Admin (logged in org matches "From Org")
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in with Club-Minor-Transactions-Admin permissions
custom_steps:
WHEN user attempts to view, print, create, delete, edit, e-sign, or submit, approve, reject, reverse, or suppress a Place on Deceased List tx

custom_steps:

AND user should not be able to view Comments field for any transaction
AND user should not be able to view Attached files section for any transaction
AND user should not be able to create, delete, submit, edit, or attach files to any BOC only Minor League transactions for Minor League players

title: Place on Deceased List Permissions - Club - Minor Transactions - Basic (logged in org matches "From Org")
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in with Club-Minor-Transactions-Basic permissions
custom_steps:
WHEN user attempts to view, print, create, delete, edit, e-sign, or submit, approve, reject, reverse, or suppress a Place on Deceased List tx
AND "From Org" on the tx is the same as logged in user's org
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to view and print all minor league transactions in all states
BUT user should not be able to view Transactions that are in Suppressed state
AND user should not be able to edit or change these transactions
AND user should not be able to see "BOC Notes" field

title: Place on Deceased List Permissions - Club - Minor Transactions - Basic (other clubs and BOC only)
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in with Club-Minor-Transactions-Basic permissions
custom_steps:
WHEN user attempts to view, print, create, delete, edit, e-sign, or submit, approve, reject, reverse, or suppress a Place on Deceased List tx
AND tx is for a player from a different org than logged in user, or is a BOC only tx
custom_expected:

GIVEN a user has a  Place on Voluntarily Retired List tx
the current date is after the assignment date entered on the transaction
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking "Approve"
custom_expected: THEN the blocker will  display  "This transaction cannot be approved unless the transaction date is on or before the current date."

title: Recalculate player's CBT impact on approval of Place on Voluntarily Retired List
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has a Place on Voluntarily Retired List tx
custom_steps: WHEN clicking "Approve"
custom_expected: THEN the system should recalculate the CBT impact of the player.

title: BOC user approving a MJ Place on Voluntarily Retired List tx to create an entry in the daily tx bulletin
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has a MJ Place on Voluntarily Retired List tx
custom_steps: WHEN the tx is approved, reversed or suppressed
custom_expected:
THEN when a MJ Place on Voluntarily Retired List transaction is approved it should appear on the current Pending Daily Transaction Bulletin as "Placed on Voluntarily Retired List"
AND when a MJ Place on Voluntarily Retired List transaction is reversed, if the "approved" bulletin entry is still on the Pending Bulletin, it should be removed. If it was on a previous Bulletin, then a new entry should be added to the current Pending Daily Transaction Bulletin as "Place on Voluntarily Retired List - Reversed" 
AND when a MJ Place on Voluntarily Retired List transaction is suppressed, if the "reversed" bulletin entry is still on the Pending Bulletin, it should be removed.

title: User can add a new Authorized Signatory from a Major League Bereavement/Family Medical Emergency List tx
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on a  Major League Bereavement/Family Medical Emergency List tx
AND the user has edit capabilities for the authorized signatory widget
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking "New"
custom_expected:
THEN a modal will launch that allows the user to enter a new Authorized Signatory for the player's Org
AND The checkbox associated with the form the user is adding a new signatory from will be auto checked and disabled

title: BOC approving a Bereavement List tx to create an entry in the daily tx bulletin
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is a BOC user
custom_steps:
When a Major League Bereavement/Family Medical Emergency List transaction is approved 
BUT if it is reversed, if the "approved" bulletin entry is still on the Pending Bulletin, it should be removed. If it was on a previous Bulletin, then a new entry should be added to the current Pending Daily Transaction Bulletin as "Placed on Bereavement List- Reversed" 
AND when it is suppressed,
custom_expected:
THEN it will appear on the current Pending Daily Transaction Bulletin as "Placed on Bereavement List"
BUt when reversed if the "approved" bulletin entry is still on the Pending Bulletin, it should be removed. If it was on a previous Bulletin, then a new entry should be added to the current Pending Daily Transaction Bulletin as "Placed on Bereavement List- Reversed" 
AND suppressed then if the "reversed" bulletin entry is still on the Pending Bulletin, it should be removed.

title: User will receive a notification on the 7th day of a player's Bereavement List placement
custom_preconds: GIVEN  if a player is on or after a player's 7th day of being on the Bereavement List.
custom_steps: WHEN the system runs the nightly check
custom_expected:
THEN a new notification is generated for both the BOC- Major Transactions- Admin and the Club- Major Transactions- Admin users
AND Type will be Inactive List. 
AND The notification description should be Please Reinstate from Major League Bereavement / Family Medical Emergency List. 
AND Both the player name and the notification description should link to the Player's Player History.

title: User can view an existing Place on Ineligible List transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in and wants to view an existing Place on Ineligible List tx from a player's Player History
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on the tx in player's Player History
custom_expected:
THEN system should open the transaction in the same window
AND layout of the transaction should match the View mode of wireframe
AND fields should match data discovery
AND "Close" button should be visible on the form in grey
AND clicking "Close" should return the user to their entry point into the tx
AND field "Current Status" should display in red if the transaction is in a preliminary state, green if pending and black for all other states

title: BOC user can create a new Place on Ineligible List tx for a MJ player
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club or BOC user is logged in and viewing a player's Player History
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Create New" button on Player History Widget
custom_expected:
THEN "Transactions" should appear as an option in top-level dropdown
AND "Major" and "Minor" radio buttons should be active
AND selecting "Major" should limit third and fourth levels to only MJ items
AND "Inactive List" should be an option under Major Transactions
AND "Place on Ineligible List" should be an option in the fourth level dropdown
AND if no Preliminary "Place on Ineligible List" tx exists within the last 10 days, selecting "Place on Ineligible List" will cause the system to load a new preliminary transaction
BUT if a Preliminary "Place on Ineligible List" tx does exist within the last 10 days system should load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction
AND transaction should follow wireframe and data discovery

title: BOC user can create a new Place on Ineligible List tx for a MN player
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club or BOC user is logged in and viewing a player's Player History
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Create New" button on Player History Widget
custom_expected:
THEN "Transactions" should appear as an option in top-level dropdown
AND "Major" and "Minor" radio buttons should be active
AND selecting "Minor" should limit third and fourth levels to only MN items
AND "Inactive List" should be an option under Minor Transactions
AND "Place on Ineligible List" should be an option in the fourth level dropdown
AND if no Preliminary "Place on Ineligible List" tx exists within the last 10 days, selecting "Place on Ineligible List" will cause the system to load a new preliminary transaction
BUT if a Preliminary "Place on Ineligible List" tx does exist within the last 10 days system should load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction
AND transaction should follow wireframe and data discovery

title: Club user will see Place on Ineligible List greyed out in the Create New map for a player from their Player History
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in as a club user
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the "Create New" map form a player's Player History
custom_expected:
THEN "Place on Ineligible List" should be an option in the fourth level dropdown (Inactive List) for both MJ and MN players, but should be greyed out
AND user should not be allowed to select this option from "Create New" map

title: Club user will receive a notification when my Place on Ineligible List tx is approved or reversed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a Place on Ineligible List transaction has been submitted to BOC
AND user is logged in as club user for the initiating club for the transaction, or the club the selected player belongs to
custom_steps:
WHEN the submitted Place on Ineligible List transaction is updated to "Approved" or "Reversed"
AND the transaction is NOT also "Suppressed"
custom_expected:
THEN logged in user should receive a notification 
AND clicking description hyperlink of any of these notifications should open the transaction in view mode in the same window/tab
AND clicking player's name hyperlink of any of these notifications should open the player's profile in view mode in the same window/tab on the Player History tab

title: User can delete a Place on Ineligible List transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a "Place on Ineligible List" transaction exists for a player
AND the transaction is in a Preliminary or Rejected state
AND a user is logged in with edit permissions for the form 
AND grey "Delete" button is displayed on the form
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Delete" button
custom_expected:
THEN system should prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the form ("Are you sure you want to delete this [Place on Ineligible List]?"
AND yes and no buttons should be displayed
AND clicking yes should close the form with no record kept, display a blue notification, and return user to entry point of the transaction
AND clicking no should return user to the form and take no action

title: BOC user can reverse a Place on Ineligible List tx
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a "Place on Ineligible  List" transaction has been submitted for a player and approved
AND user is logged in as BOC user 
AND user is viewing the approved transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks grey "Reverse" button
custom_expected:
THEN system should run all required field and formatting checks and display relevant error or warning messages
AND successful reverse notification should display (message #16)
AND transaction status should update to "Reversed"
AND reversed transaction should display in Player History with "Voided" in front of the transaction
AND player's MJ and MN Roster Status, Club and Org should be set to values from prior to transaction approval

title: BOC user can suppress a reversed a Place on Ineligible List tx
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a reversed "Place on Ineligible List" transaction exists for a player 
AND user is logged in with permission to suppress the transaction
AND grey "Suppress" button is displayed on the form
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Suppress" button
custom_expected:
THEN transaction should be suppressed
AND transaction should be hidden from player's Player History
AND transaction should be hidden from searches (unless BOC user searches specifically for suppressed)
AND transaction should be hidden from any other place it is visible on UI

title: BOC user can reverse and suppress a Place on Ineligible List tx
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a reversed "Place on Ineligible List" transaction exists for a player 
AND user is logged in with permission to "Reverse and Suppress" the transaction
AND grey "Reverse and Suppress" button is displayed on the form
custom_steps: WHEN user selects "Reverse and Suppress" from the dropdown
custom_expected:
THEN the transaction will first be reversed
AND player's Club, MJ, and MN Roster statuses and level of play should be updated to their values from prior to transaction approval
AND transaction should be suppressed
AND transaction should be hidden from player's Player History
AND transaction should be hidden from searches (unless BOC user searches specifically for suppressed)
AND transaction should be hidden from any other place it is visible on UI

title: BOC user can reverse and suppress a Place on Ineligible List tx - Not Latest Approved tx
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a "Place on Ineligible List" transaction has been submitted for a player and approved
AND user is logged in as BOC user 
AND user is viewing the approved transaction
AND player has one or more approved transactions dated later than selected transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Reverse" or "Reverse and Suppress" button
custom_expected:
THEN user will receive error message "Only the player's latest approved transaction can be reversed."
AND clicking "Back" will close modal and return user to the transaction
